options.C: SPF 2 – Drivers Policy
options.D: SEF 44 – Family Protection Endorsement

questions.question: Compensatory damages are those which are intended to compensate the wronged party __________ for the injury or damage caused by the insured __________

options.A: Plaintiff; defendant
options.B: Defendant; plaintiff
options.C: Defendant or plaintiff; third party
options.D: Wronged party; plaintiff

questions.question: A third party is ________

options.A: One who is party to the contract and thereby has rights therein
options.B: One who is not a party to the agreement or to a transaction but who may have rights therein.
options.C: One whom is party to the contract and thereby does not have rights therein
options.D: None of above

questions.question: The insurer’s liability under the insurance policy is limited to the payment of __________ damages only.

options.A: Punitive, nominal and compensatory damages
options.B: Nominal and punitive damages only
options.C: Compensatory damages only
options.D: Nominal, punitive and exemplary damages

questions.question: Liability Insurance – The types of bodily injury which the insurer agrees to pay on behalf of the insured include:

options.A: Bodily injury; sickness or disease; death resulting from any of these at any time
options.B: Bodily injury, death resulting from bodily injury
options.C: Sickness or disease or death resulting from any sickness or disease
options.D: Clear and malingering injury

questions.question: A Tort is a private or civil wrong, other than breach of contract, for which the court will provide a remedy in the form of an action for damages. Which of the following is not considered a Tort?

options.A: Trespass
options.B: Defamation of character (libel or slander)
options.C: False arrest
options.D: Murder

questions.question: Factors influencing depreciation charged include:

options.A: Condition of the item, size of item, purchase price
options.B: Condition of the property, obsolescence, normal life expectancy, resale value
options.C: Condition of the property, obsolescence, normal life expectancy, wear and tear, colour
options.D: Obsolescence, resale value, purchase price

questions.question: The limit stated on the insurance policy for bodily injury and property damage liability is available for each occurrence. In other words, even if a claim has been paid, the limit stated in the policy will be available again to pay future claims. This is called:

options.A: Aggregate limit
options.B: Stepped limits
options.C: Per occurrence form
options.D: Insurance policy limit form

questions.question: Section B of SPF 1 defines Dependent Relative as:

options.A: A person, under 18 living in the household, financially dependent on the parent or spouse of the parent or both of them for financial support
options.B: A person, 18 years of age and older, living in the household and requiring financial support from the head of household or their spouse, due to their mental infirmity or physical disability
options.C: A person over 18 years of age, living in the household and requiring financial support from the head of household or their spouse, due to their mental infirmity or physical disability
options.D: A and B

questions.question: After an auto loss, where the insured does not take precautionary measures to protect the vehicle from further loss or damage, and a subsequent loss occurs, this consequential loss is:

options.A: Covered subject to a second deductible if the peril is covered under the policy
options.B: Covered under the original cause of loss
options.C: Covered but the adjuster will investigate fully
options.D: Not covered

questions.question: Your clients have been renting a unit in a high-rise condominium building and have carried a tenants package with your office. They have just purchased a condominium unit similar to the one that they have been renting, and will soon be moving to their new condo unit. What advice do you provide to meet the needs for insuring their new condominium unit?

options.A: Transfer their existing policy (as is) to their new address. The buildings are similar, and they do not plan to buy any new contents right away
options.B: Cancel the entire policy. They no longer have any need for insurance as the condominium corporation is required by law to insure all exposures for the owners of each individual unit
options.C: Get full details of the security arrangements and alarm systems in the building. You will then be able to recommend how much fire and theft insurance that they need to carry
options.D: Cancel their tenants policy and apply for a special package policy designed specifically for condominium unit owners

questions.question: You inherit a valuable painting which you intend to exhibit periodically at various art galleries. This would best be insured under:

options.A: Personal Articles Endorsement
options.B: Homeowners Broad Form policy
options.C: Fine Arts Endorsement
options.D: Tenants package polciy

questions.question: A CONFLICT OF INTEREST position means a situation where an intermediary:

options.A: Is charging an excessive rate of interest on a payment plan
options.B: Is looking at the best interests of the client and other stakeholders
options.C: Has an incentive to act other than in the best interest of the client
options.D: Commits a civil wrong other than a breach of contract

questions.question: Professional brokers associations have codes of conduct which specify brokers duties to clients, insurers and to fellow brokers. Which of the following is NOT a duty owed to fellow brokers?

options.A: To not harm their reputation
options.B: To adhere to the binding authority granted by the insurer
options.C: To cooperate in every reasonable way for the betterment of the industry
options.D: To encourage public respect for an endeavour to improve the practice of their vocation

questions.question: You have advised your client who owns a retail outlet to install an automatic sprinkler system in their premises. Implementing selected risk management strategies requires both technical and managerial decisions to be made. A technical decision is what must be done. Which of the following decisions is NOT an example of a technical decision?

options.A: Who will be responsible for the project
options.B: What type of sprinkler system will be required
options.C: What building permits will be required
options.D: What must be done to minimize disruption of customer service at the store

questions.question: Based on the principal and agent legal relationship, it is understood that an insurer’s (principal’s ) knowledge of a risk is the same of that as the agent’s (also called intermediary). What does this mean?

options.A: Full disclosure to the intermediary by the client is required
options.B: Information given to the intermediary by the client is deemed to be given to the insurer
options.C: Both the insurer and the intermediary are expected to be knowledgeable
options.D: Both the insurer and the intermediary are partners in protecting the client from fortuitous events

questions.question: Your client has bought a cabin at the lake. He needs to rebuild this cabin to make it structurally sound, and he has some friends in the construction business. Explain to the client the risk he is undertaking:

options.A: As he doesn't stay there, there is no risk
options.B: Speculative risk as he may move in another time
options.C: He requires a seasonal policy and Course of Construction coverage once construction commences. This is pure risk
options.D: He needs homeowners tenants policy waiving the liability coverage

questions.question: The Alberta Superintendent of Insurance in Alberta:

options.A: Approves policy wordings used by varying companies
options.B: Approves endorsement wordings used by varying companies
options.C: Administers the Claims Arbitration Agreement
options.D: A & B

questions.question: Your client has taken up driving UBER as part of the Transportation Network for ride-share arrangements. You advise them:

options.A: Cancel their SPF#1, they are covered under the SPF#9 of UBER
options.B: Retain their SPF#1 as they are covered under their own policy when not using their vehicle as part of the transportation network
options.C: Buy an SPF#9 which is sold to UBER
options.D: Sell their vehicle the risk is too great

questions.question: The purpose of the Total Disability Coverage under Section B, Subsection 2, Part 2 of the SPF#1 is:

options.A: To provide payment for any medical expenses which the insured may incur
options.B: To provide the insured with temporary funds for the period of injury until such time as all of the lost earnings re recovered from the responsible party
options.C: To provide a substitute for some of the earnings which an insured may lose as a result of injury sustained in an accident if the injury prevents the insured from working
options.D: To provide punitive damages if the insured suffers a total disability or dismembermen

questions.question: The SEF 44 – Family Protection Endorsement:

options.A: Protects the insured and eligible passengers in their vehicle for liability of a third party whose own insurance is insufficient to cover their claims for bodily injury
options.B: Is mandatory coverage in Alberta
options.C: Provides the same coverage as uninsured motorist coverage while driving in Quebec, BC, Saskatchewan or Manitoba
options.D: Provides protection to the insured for damages to their own vehicle, provided they do not have collision insurance, and is able to identify either the owner or the driver of the uninsured third party

questions.question: The SEF 9 is a marine use excluded endorsement, which removes water damage under Comprehensive and All Perils coverages to any vehicle used in water if applied. Which of the following losses would be excluded if a Standard Endorsement form # 9 (SEF 9) was attached to the Auto policy

options.A: Theft of the quad or snowmobile
options.B: Collision with a boulder
options.C: Riding across a half-frozen lake and sinking
options.D: Injury to the passenger (Section B)

questions.question: The SPF#9 is a Transportation Network Policy, used by Uber, Lyft and other ride-share operators. This policy provides coverage to operators of ride-share because the exposure is:

options.A: Carrying passengers for compensation but only covered when their Uber sign is on
options.B: Carrying explosives
options.C: Carrying passengers for compensation if the app is on
options.D: Carrying passengers for compensation when the ride has been accepted through the app

questions.question: On a farm insurance policy, if an outbuilding is damaged more than two-thirds of its value, an initial payment of 50% will be made. The remaining balance will be payable if:

options.A: It is repaired or replaced within three months of the date of loss or damage
options.B: It is replaced with a building designed for the same purposes
options.C: It is repaired or replaced in the exact location as the damaged building was situated
options.D: All of the above

questions.question: Our insured has purchased a new acreage. They are planning to move their mobile home this weekend, and have hired a transport company to disconnect water and sewer services and move this mobile home. It happens to be a very windy day and the home is damaged due to wind. How will their mobile home policy respond?

options.A: Covered because windstorm is an insured peril
options.B: Covered for 5% of building limit if it is an emergency
options.C: Not covered under the mobile home policy as it is cargo and in the care, custody and control of the transport carrier
options.D: The house is covered because it is windstorm, but not the contents

questions.question: Which of the following are NOT true of mobile home policy?

options.A: There is no coverage when the house is being moved unless it is for emergency purposes
options.B: There is no coverage for embezzlement, theft or secretion or gambling it in away or giving it away
options.C: There is no coverage for outdoor satellite dish if caused by windstorm
options.D: Mobile home policies are either BASIC or COMPREHENSIVE with replacement cost

questions.question: Our insured has a comprehensive home policy with no Personal Articles Endorsements, but has sporting equipment. Which of the following losses are excluded?

options.A: Damage cause by fire, lightning or theft
options.B: Only theft is excluded as a peril under Comprehensive policy
options.C: Damage caused when the equipment is in use is excluded, example, breakage of hockey stick
options.D: Both answers B and C are excluded

questions.question: Insurance is a form of spreading the losses of the few among the premiums of the many and benefits society in general. How?

options.A: Because clients have to have insurance
options.B: Because it gives people peace of mind. They can know that their funds are set aside for insurance purposes and therefore use their own savings and funds in other ways, stimulating the economy
options.C: People all sue, and we are in a litigious environment. Insurance ensures that people can sue
options.D: None of the above

questions.question: If an insured business declares bankruptcy and afterward their building burns in a fire, under Statutory Conditions, the Insurer:

options.A: The insurer would make payment as they are required to do so until the Bankruptcy Trustee has completed the sale of this businesses assets
options.B: No payment is made
options.C: Fire is never a covered peril, and especially after a bankruptcy as it is likely arson
options.D: The insured would be liable

questions.question: Which of the following situations would likely result in an Errors and Omissions claim?

options.A: You did not fully understand the nature of your clients business risk; consequently you did not identify or recommend coverage for an exposure
options.B: You incorrectly advised your client that coverage was not available for a portion of their risk
options.C: Your client thought that they were insured and they suffered a loss before you forwarded the application to the insurer for binding confirmation
options.D: All of the above can result in an error or omissions claim
